feedback.Physical object: Excluded — The salute is not a discrete material object but a performative gesture.
feedback.Man-made / synthetic: Excluded — The gesture itself is not a fabricated artifact, but an enacted social signal.
feedback.Biological or biologically-inspired: Excluded — Not rooted in biological structure or inspiration.
feedback.Fixed/static: Excluded — It is temporally enacted, not spatially fixed.
feedback.Structural: Excluded — It does not exhibit internal components or organization.
feedback.Perceptible: Excluded — While observable, its perceptibility does not define its ontological status.
feedback.Material form: Excluded — It has no persistent material embodiment.
feedback.Passive: Excluded — It requires intentional human performance.
feedback.Purposeful / intentional: Included — Deliberate act of social ritual with codified intention.
feedback.Emits output / produces effect: Excluded — Produces no autonomous effect; signaling depends on interpretation.
feedback.Processes or regulates logic/signals: Excluded — Not a computational or signal-processing entity.
feedback.Transforms or modifies internal state: Excluded — It does not inherently track or update state.
feedback.Interacts with humans directly: Excluded — Enacted by humans, but not interactive in the UHT sense.
feedback.Part of a larger system: Included — Exists only within hierarchical institutions that define it.
feedback.Autonomous in function: Excluded — Requires human initiation and performance.
feedback.System-critical: Excluded — Culturally meaningful, but not infrastructurally essential.
feedback.Symbolic / representational: Included — The gesture stands for abstract values like respect, allegiance, and discipline.
feedback.Communicative: Included — Conveys nonverbal information about status, protocol, or recognition.
feedback.Logical / rule-based: Excluded — Though enacted according to rules, it does not itself embody logical structures.
feedback.Hierarchical / modular: Excluded — The concept is not built from separable internal parts.
feedback.Behavior-guiding: Included — Prescribes specific actions and responses according to role.
feedback.Self-referential / meta-conceptual: Excluded — The concept does not reference or model itself.
feedback.Temporal: Excluded — Executed in time, but not defined by temporal structuring.
feedback.Contextual abstraction: Excluded — Its meaning is socially fixed and not flexibly abstracted across domains.
feedback.Socially / culturally constructed: Included — Embedded in long-standing traditions and military culture.
feedback.Defined by a group/system: Included — Officially codified by institutions such as national militaries.
feedback.Linked to identity or role: Included — Reflects status, allegiance, and role within an organizational hierarchy.
feedback.Regulated / governed: Included — Specific procedures and interpretations governed by manuals and doctrine.
feedback.Teachable / transmissible: Included — Explicitly trained and transmitted through formal instruction.
feedback.Visible: Included — Publicly enacted for mutual recognition.
feedback.Context-sensitive: Included — Its meaning and appropriateness depend on situation and role.
feedback.Widely known: Included — Recognized across many societies and institutional systems.

encoding_notes: Revised to include symbolic and communicative functions intrinsic to the ritualized gesture. Exclusions strictly follow the non-object, non-autonomous, non-logical nature of the act. Represents a signal embedded in hierarchy and ceremony.
